fields.summary: Display of main pages in the screen of Page Tree Search Macro search box.

fields.description:
h3. Environment
- Only happens to Confluence 5.9.x
- Only happens in Windows environment. OSX and Linux not affected.

h3. Diagonosis:
The following errors appears in the logs.
{code}
015-10-28 19:14:07,724 ERROR [Indexer: 1] [pdfbox.pdmodel.font.PDSimpleFont] getSpaceWidth Can't determine the width of the space character using 250 as default
 -- referer: http://localhost:8090/admin/search-indexes.action | url: /admin/reindex.action | userName: admin | action: reindex
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: name
	at sun.misc.URLClassPath$Loader.findResource(Unknown Source)
	at sun.misc.URLClassPath.findResource(Unknown Source)
	at java.net.URLClassLoader$2.run(Unknown Source)
	at java.net.URLClassLoader$2.run(Unknown Source)
	at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
	at java.net.URLClassLoader.findResource(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.catalina.loader.WebappClassLoaderBase.findResource(WebappClassLoaderBase.java:946)
	at org.apache.catalina.loader.WebappClassLoaderBase.getResourceAsStream(WebappClassLoaderBase.java:1117)
	at org.apache.fontbox.util.ResourceLoader.loadResource(ResourceLoader.java:62)
	at org.apache.fontbox.util.FontManager.findTTFont(FontManager.java:331)
	at org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.font.PDTrueTypeFont.getTTFFont(PDTrueTypeFont.java:638)
{code}

h3. Cause
The PDF documents might contain some specific special characters or some exotic fonts.
Reference: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/PDFBOX-1706 
(Please note that the attachment in this link doesn't generate the error)

h3. Reason
The error occurs when apache pdf box is trying to index pdf attachments.

On text extraction pdfbox tries to render text and lookup right fonts. Strictly speaking, it's not needed at all because the purpose of indexing is to find raw text and Confluence is not interested in any visual representation of text.

However, *the indexing still works and PDF attachment contents are completely searchable.*

h3. Workaround to suppress the error
To remove the error in the logs, go to <Confluence Installation>\confluence\WEB-INF\classes\log4j.properties and add the log level to FATAL for this particular class.

{code}
log4j.logger.org.apache.pdfbox.pdmodel.font.PDSimpleFont=FATAL
{code}

(!) Please note that after doing this, all other error thrown from this class will not be shown in the logs in the future.
Alternatively, you can choose to just ignore the error in the logs.
fields.summary: PDF Index: Can't determine the width of the space error is logged on Windows

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40391].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Timestamps are wrong for recently *Recently Worked on*. The recent changes are showing as yesterday.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page;
# Check the *Recently worked on*.

h3. Expected Results
It should be showing as *Today*.

h3. Actual Results
It will show as *yesterday*.
fields.summary: Timestamps are wrong for recently worked on and recently visited

fields.description:
As per this [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf54/confluence-administrator-s-guide/configuring-a-confluence-environment/important-directories-and-files/confluence-home-directory] in regards to home directories.

{code}An alternative directory may be specified for temporary data by setting the webwork.multipart.saveDir property in confluence.cfg.xml.{code}

However, by doing so, the 'Chart' macro crashes: images are generated inside the folder, but the HTML is still using the %HOME%/temp and we have an error 404 (file not found) instead of the image.

 !ScreenshotWithoutSensitiveInfo.png|thumbnail! 

h4. Steps To Replicate
# Create a page
# Insert a chart using chart macro
# Edit confluence.cfg.xml
# Override webwork.multipart.saveDir to an alternative path
# Restart Confluence
# Open the page again
fields.summary: Bug with Chart macro when overriding webwork.multipart.saveDir

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40386].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Attempting to add certain users to Team Calendar Events or sharing items with these users will redirect you to their User Profile instead.
This bug occurs when a user's avatar has spaces in its filename. This happens because we attempt to construct a java.net.URI from the path to the user's avatar without percent-encoding first - the space character is not permitted in a URI.
Affected users have a grey avatar icon instead of their own uploaded avatar.

h3. Environment
* Confluence 6.0.0-OD-2016.02.1-0006
* Team Calendar 5.3.10-D20151229T094001

h3. Steps to reproduce:
1. Open the share dialog on a page, or a calendar event
2. Type an affected user's name in the autocomplete field
3. In the autocomplete results observe that the user's avatar is not present, but is a grey person outline instead
4. Clicking on the result to add it the share dialog navigates to the profile page instead (hence losing the content that was typed in the share dialog) and the console shows a JS error originating from {{Confluence.Templates.Share.Dialog.recipientUser}} - when pausing on the error you can see that $thumbnailLink is undefined

!share profile.png!
h3. Workaround
Affected users will need to upload a new profile picture which does not have any spaces in the filename.
fields.summary: Can't share page with specific users, or add them to Calendar events (thumbnailLink is undefined, leading to JS error)

fields.description:
Currently Confluence with MySQL 5.7 is affected by this: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/%27Page+Not+Found%27+when+navigating+to+Confluence+Questions+due+to+com.mysema.query.QueryException]

Which is caused by this:
{code:java}
Caused by: com.mysema.query.QueryException: Caught SQLException for delete from `CONTENTPROPERTIES`
where `CONTENTPROPERTIES`.`PROPERTYID` in (select `PROPERTY_ID`
from (select `answerProperties`.`PROPERTYID` as `PROPERTY_ID`
from `CONTENT` `answers`
join `CONTENTPROPERTIES` `answerProperties`
on `answerProperties`.`CONTENTID` = `answers`.`CONTENTID`
left join (select `questionProperties`.`LONGVAL` as `ANSWER_ID`
from `CONTENT` `questions`
join `CONTENTPROPERTIES` `questionProperties`
on `questionProperties`.`CONTENTID` = `questions`.`CONTENTID`
where `questions`.`PLUGINKEY` = 'com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-questions:question' and `questions`.`PREVVER` is null and `questionProperties`.`PROPERTYNAME` = 'accepted') as `ACCEPTED_ANSWER_IDS`
on `answers`.`CONTENTID` = `ANSWER_ID`
where `answers`.`PLUGINKEY` = 'com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-questions:answer' and `answers`.`PREVVER` is null and `answerProperties`.`PROPERTYNAME` = 'accepted' and `ANSWER_ID` is null) as `TMP`)
    at com.mysema.query.sql.DefaultSQLExceptionTranslator.translate(DefaultSQLExceptionTranslator.java:38)
    at com.mysema.query.sql.Configuration.translate(Configuration.java:451)
    at com.mysema.query.sql.dml.SQLDeleteClause.execute(SQLDeleteClause.java:169)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.questions.internal.upgrade.DuplicatedAcceptedAnswersRemover.deleteDuplicatedAcceptedAnswers(DuplicatedAcceptedAnswersRemover.java:83)
...
    at com.atlassian.activeobjects.internal.AbstractActiveObjectsFactory.create(AbstractActiveObjectsFactory.java:67)
    at com.atlassian.activeobjects.internal.DelegatingActiveObjectsFactory.create(DelegatingActiveObjectsFactory.java:32)
    at com.atlassian.activeobjects.osgi.TenantAwareActiveObjects$1$1$1.call(TenantAwareActiveObjects.java:91)
    ... 6 more
Caused by: java.sql.SQLException: You can't specify target table 'CONTENTPROPERTIES' for update in FROM clause
{code}
Different syntax in MySQL 5.7. This seems to only affect Confluence Questions add-on.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*UPDATE:* The SQLException above was fixed in Questions for Confluence 1.0.618. If you install the latest version, it won't be a problem.
{panel}
fields.summary: Support MySQL 5.7

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Set up a one node cluster
# Either populate the instance with a lot of data or disable index flushing job so that reindexing will block index flush from happening during startup
# Stop the node
# Remove $\{CONFLUENCE_HOME\}/journal/main_index file
# Start the node and let reindexing complete
# Restart the node

Outcome: Reindexing is triggered again

Suggested fix: Update journal id to be the id of the latest entry in journalentry table at the beginning of reindexing.
fields.summary: Automatic reindexing can trigger unnecessarily

fields.description:
When you copy a row from a page property macro and paste in another row of the same macro, the editor inserts a tag in the beginning and end of the word. Before, the word was between a

tag. This causes no harm on the visible result since we can only see this change in the source code of the page. However, macros that relies on the source metadata are directly affected. As example, the Comala workflow. These screenshoots illustrate the behavior. h5. The Source !source_example.JPG|thumbnail! h5. The Output !output_example.JPG|thumbnail! h3.Expected result Copy/paste rows in page properties macro without adding extra tags h3.Workaround Install [Confluence Source Editor plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.editor.confluence-source-editor/server/overview] and copy/paste the row while in the source editor mode
fields.summary: Page properties inserts span character on copied rows

fields.description:
The TOC links generated are not permanent and it changes according to top down sequence if contents are suddenly added before it with the same name.

For an example, the SubChild page for Title2 is linked to this URL 
http://localhost:8090/display/ADMIN/asdsadsada#asdsadsada-Subchild.1

!toc1.PNG|thumbnail! 

If some contents is suddenly added before it, then it'll be shifted down and the URL would be 
http://localhost:8090/display/ADMIN/asdsadsada#asdsadsada-Subchild.2
 !toc2.PNG|thumbnail! 

This would be very troublesome if the links are pinned and referred from other pages/sites.
This will refer them to the wrong part of the page which provides the wrong information.

h3. *Workaround*
Do not use Titles/Subtitles with duplicate names. Append a number/alphabet to it to differentiate the titles.
fields.summary: Table of Content links change if edited and the same title is added before it
Velocity Context Module incomplete or outdated

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40378].
  {panel}

Currently, Confluence allows you to disable signups entirely, have completely unrestricted signups (from any domain), or specify a list of email domains that are allowed to sign up - in which case an email with a token is sent to the user to verify they own the email address.

As an open source project, we need to have unrestricted public signups to Confluence (and JIRA) - we want people to get involved, and we can't know what email domains they are going to use (it could be a personal email address, or one associated with their employment).

These unrestricted sign ups are also completely unverified - as a result, and even with the (poor) captcha implementation in place, we are getting hit by automated signups to our public Confluence (and JIRA), and getting spam content and comments getting added to the sites.

If the email addresses were verified to be real by sending an email with a verification token before login was allowed, then this would greatly assist in reducing spam.

I would like to see the existing email account verification that is present when restricting to a domain to be available as an option for the "unrestricted signups" - so that people can register using any email domain, but they can not affect the content until they verify their email address.

This should apply to possible signups through JIRA as well as Confluence.
fields.summary: Enable email confirmation for all signups

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Disabling users does not reduce the license count when:
# A duplicated user exists on the lower directory order
# The duplicated user is active, and has a Confluence "can-use" permission

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a user in the confluence internal directory. Give this user the confluence-users group in order to give the user the "can-use" permission
# Go to Confluence Admin > License > Refresh. The license count increased as the new user is counted towards the license
# Connect Confluence to any User Management (LDAP/AD)
# Move this external user to top of the User Directory so Confluence will use users in this directory.
# Create another user with the same user name as internal one in the external directory From LDAP side
# Disable this user so that this user would not be able to log in to confluence

h3. Expected Results
# User will not be able to log in to Confluence (This behavior is true)
# Go to Confluence Admin > License > Refresh. User License count will be decreased by 1

h3. Actual Results
# User will not be able to log in to Confluence
# Go to Confluence Admin > License > Refresh. User License count is not decreased.

h3.Workaround
# Disable the user that's belong to the internal directory by selecting the internal directory as the top most position, disable the user, before putting the external directory in the top most position.
fields.summary: Disabled Users From External Directory Still Counted Into License When A Duplicated Username Exists in the Other Directory

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40365].
  {panel}

Currently only 4 gadgets are bundled in Confluence:


* *Activity Stream*: Lists recent activity in a single project, or in all projects.
* *Confluence Page Gadget*: This gadget renders a Confluence Page.
* *Confluence QuickNav*: This gadget allows you to embed the Confluence QuickNav into other applications.
* *Confluence News*: News about Confluence.

An additional gadget which shows the page directory for Confluence spaces should be bundled in Confluence. The gadget would be useful for JIRA users to see a page directory from their JIRA dashboards.
fields.summary: Bundle page directory gadget in Confluence

Hello,

In a Confluence 5.9.2 page I pasted in a JIRA search query so we can list items labeled 7.2. fields.description:
h2. Summary

It is not possible to hide the license banner that announces the end of support.

h2. Expected behaviour
Clicking "remind me later" or "never remind me again" should hide the banner.

h2. Actual behaviour
After clicking "remind me later" or "never remind me again", the banner disappears but it will come back after a page reload or browsing another Confluence page. Also, a warning message is printed to atlassian-confluence.log:
{code}
2015-12-28 13:46:23,847 WARN [http-nio-8090-exec-11] [common.security.jersey.XsrfResourceFilter] passesAllXsrfChecks XSRF checks failed for request: https://<confluence_url_here>/rest/licensebanner/1.0/reminder/never , origin: null , referrer: https://<confluence_url_here>/
 -- referer: https://<confluence_url_here>/ | url: /rest/licensebanner/1.0/reminder/never | userName: <username>
{code}

h2. Workaround
* Install add-blocker browser plugin and block the HTML
or
* Disable the Confluence License Banner by
*# Go to !https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/files/157679812/Cog.png! > Add-Ons
*# Select System from the select list
*# Enter *Confluence License Banner* in the text field
*# Open Confluence License Banner and click Disable
or
* Buy a new licence

h3. Problem Definition
When the Confluence Task is placed within a table cell, it will only recognise text and user mentions only within that table cell and next to the task itself.

It would be useful for the Task macro to recognise that it is within a table and include whole table row into the task body so these are visible in Task Reports, properly searchable and can be assigned to people.
Managing tasks in a table is the desired alternative to lists, at the moment, tasks can only be viewed in a table via Task Report Macro.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40333].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When you upload a PDF file in a Confluence page, then click on that when viewing the page. Confluence will preview that PDF. The  CTRL/CMD+F shortcut key doesn't open the Find dialog to allow the user to search that PDF.

h3. Steps to replicate
# Access a page that contains a PDF attachment
# Preview the attachment
# Use the  CTRL/CMD+F command

h3. Expected results
The Find tool opens

h3. Actual results
Nothing happens

h3. Suggested Solution
Confluence PDF Preview should bind CTRL/CMD+F key shortcut to open the Find dialog.

h3. Workaround
There are currently three workarounds:
# In your preferred browser, lookup the Find menu in your browser options and select it
# Download the attachment locally and search in it
# Issue the CTRL/CMD+F command before opening the attachment preview
fields.summary: Enable the use of CTRL/CMD+F shortcut to activate the Find tool in browsers

fields.description:
After upgrading to 5.9.x, custom language pack used for Code Block Macro has stopped working

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Upload custom language pack: *abaphighlighter* into your *Confluence Admin > Configure Code Macro: Add a new language*.
2. Optional: Set your Confluence Default Language to the custom language pack.
3. On a Page, insert *Code Block Macro* with the following parameters:

* *Syntax Highlighting:* abaphighlighter
* *Theme:* FadeToGrey

4. Click on *Save* to insert the Code Block Macro into the Page.
5. Put in a Sample Code (refer to *Testing Notes*)

h3. Expected Result:

* Code Block Macro should show the correct Theme and Syntax Highlighting as per the custom language pack

h3. Actual Result:

* Code Block Macro showing no Theme and no custom Syntax Highlighting as per the custom language pack

h3. Additional Notes:

* Screenshots attached for Testing Results
* Custom Language pack attached

h3. WorkAround 

[Manually downgrade the Code Block Macro plugin|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/UPM/Downgrading+an+Add-on+to+an+Earlier+Version] to version 2.1.7. 

To downgrade the add-on, do the following:

# Stop Confluence.
# Locate the existing .jar files (newcode-macro-plugin-XXX.jar) in {{<confluence-install>}}/confluence/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins/. Move the file to a different location to create a backup copy.
# Place the attached,  [^newcode-macro-plugin-2.1.7.jar] , into the {{atlassian-bundled-plugins}} directory.
# Locate the existing transformed .jar (newcode-macro-plugin-XXX_XXX) in {{<confluence-install>/plugins-osgi-cache/transformed-plugins/}}.Delete the file. 
# Start Confluence.

(!) As with all recommendations, we *strongly* suggest testing this in a test environment prior to implementing in Production.  If this causes other issues in your instance, you will be asked to switch back to the original version of the .jar.
fields.summary: Custom language pack for Code Block Macro stopped working in 5.9.x

fields.description:
Files of type .txt are not in the list of file types that open in the previewer. They should be.

In older versions (5.3 in our case) links to attached text files and SQL files (ie, *.txt and *.sql) open the files in the user's default application. (for ex, Notepad or IDE)

In v5.9 (which we're trying to migrate to), the links produce the ugly "Can't Preview this File - You must Download to see this File" message. 

That's lost functionality.

It would be nice to be able to list a set of file extensions that should preview as text - eg, json, html, xml, etc.
fields.summary: In v5.9 of Confluence, text files are not "previewed"
Restrict comment for a specific individual/group in a group

fields.description:
In the documentation Running Confluence Over SSL or HTTPS for Confluence version 5.9:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/running-confluence-over-ssl-or-https-161203.html#RunningConfluenceOverSSLorHTTPS-CertificateOption2

The connector described in the documentation lack of certain parameters that exist in Confluence 5.9 server XML.

In the documentation:
{code}
<Connector port="8443" maxHttpHeaderSize="8192"
                   maxThreads="150" minSpareThreads="25" maxSpareThreads="75"
                   enableLookups="false" disableUploadTimeout="true"
                   acceptCount="100" scheme="https" secure="true"
                   clientAuth="false" sslProtocol="TLS" SSLEnabled="true"
                   URIEncoding="UTF-8" keystorePass="<MY_CERTIFICATE_PASSWORD>"/>
{code}

in the server.xml bundled in Confluence 5.9:

{code}
        <Connector port="8443" maxHttpHeaderSize="8192"
                   maxThreads="150" minSpareThreads="25"
                   protocol="org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11NioProtocol"
                   enableLookups="false" disableUploadTimeout="true"
                   acceptCount="100" scheme="https" secure="true"
                   clientAuth="false" sslProtocols="TLSv1,TLSv1.1,TLSv1.2" sslEnabledProtocols="TLSv1,TLSv1.1,TLSv1.2" SSLEnabled="true"
                   URIEncoding="UTF-8" keystorePass="<MY_CERTIFICATE_PASSWORD>"/>{code}

Which could be confusing and misleading
fields.summary: Add the necessary parameter in the Running Confluence Over SSL or HTTPS documentation

Steps to reproduce:

1. Open the Keyboard Shortcuts dialog (menu: Help > Keyboard Shortcuts).
2. Uncheck "Enable General Shortcuts"
3. Close the dialog.
4. Go view any page that you are allowed to edit and/or can comment on.

I haven't checked all of the shortcuts. There may be others that also aren't disabled.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40313].
  {panel}

h2.Description

When performing a single page XML export (not the entire Space, just a single page), if there are any Blogs in that Space, the Blogs get exported in addition to the page you are trying to export. If there are attachments in these Blogs, those also get exported. 

h2.Suggestion

It should be possible to opt out of exporting all Blogs when trying to export a single page. In some cases, there may be dozens of Blogs and many gigabytes of attachments. Instead of getting a small file with the single page export, you can end up with a massive, multi-gigabyte export.

h2.Steps to reproduce

1. Perform an XML export of a single page in a Space that has Blogs with attachments.
2. Download the exported page export and then import into a different Confluence instance and observe that the page is imported along with all Blogs in the space as well as the attachments.
fields.summary: Single page XML export should not export blogs and their attachments

Comments on files have a date, everywhere else in Confluence where the date of a piece of content is displayed, that date is also a permalink to the item in question. This is not true for file viewer comments.

Reproduce:
* Create a page with an image.
* View the page.
* Click on the image.
* Make a comment on said image.
* View this comment in the image viewer modal thingy.
* Note that the date is not a link.

When using the Page Include Macro the first paragraph break is being removed from the included page. This appears to affect anyone that uses Page Include

h3. Environment
Does not appear to be environment specific

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page with multiple lines (See Image Two)

# On the Macro Page insert a {Include Page} selecting the page created in step one
# Note that the first paragraph break has disappeared on the macro page despite still being there on the page from step one (see image03)

h3. Expected Results
The expected results are that the first paragraph break would be included in the macro page.

h3. Actual Results
The first paragraph break is not seen.

Tested in 5.8.18 and this issue was not occurring.

h3.Workaround
No known workaround.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40304].
  {panel}

I'm working on code to import content from our custom in-house Wiki to Confluence via the API and I'm finding the Confluence REST API documentation to be really inadequate:

Requests and especially responses are not detailed in full, so I keep having to just spit out the response to my requests and divine the object model.  It's really a bummer since you fine folks obviously know all this info.  Why not share?

I'd like to see all possible responses fully documented:
- A happy-path example with all possible options in the request and response.
- All possible errors (e.g. not authorized, duplicate space key, etc.), again all possible options in the request and response.

Also, FYI, my employer plans to open source my work as the beginnings of a C# Confluence REST API client, a la Octokit.NET, in case anyone finds this work useful.
fields.summary: Confluence REST API Documentation is Inadequate

fields.description:
The Confluence UI considers space keys to be case-insensitive, e.g. 2 spaces with "test" and "TEST" as keys will not be allowed.

The Confluence API, on the other hand, will not return a value for a GET with querystring parameter "test" if the key it was created with was "TEST".
fields.summary: Space keys are case-insensitive in the UI, but case-sensitive in the REST API

# Create another page with a live search macro
# Search for the attachment (do not press enter) and the dropdown menu will be shown.

The link is incorrectly generated due to the comma.

fields.description:
Here is the step to reproduce: 
# Install a Confluence old cluster with Confluence version 5.5.6 or earlier.
# Upgrade the Confluence instance to version 5.6.6 or later.

h3. Expected behaviour
Confluence should startup and trigger the upgrade task.

h3. Current behaviour
The Confluence startup with the following message in the log file:
{noformat}
2015-12-22 11:28:24,961 INFO [localhost-startStop-1] [com.atlassian.confluence.lifecycle] contextInitialized Starting Confluence 5.6.6 [build 5639 based on commit hash a252d7f5e75d7a8bf7047b4b2c92f71a56a8f048]
2015-12-22 11:28:26,592 INFO [localhost-startStop-1] [atlassian.plugin.manager.DefaultPluginManager] earlyStartup Plugin system earlyStartup begun
2015-12-22 11:28:28,442 INFO [localhost-startStop-1] [atlassian.plugin.manager.DefaultPluginManager] earlyStartup Plugin system earlyStartup finished in 0:00:01.849
2015-12-22 11:28:28,443 INFO [localhost-startStop-1] [atlassian.plugin.manager.DefaultPluginManager] lateStartup Plugin system lateStartup begun
2015-12-22 11:28:29,537 INFO [localhost-startStop-1] [atlassian.plugin.manager.DefaultPluginManager] lateStartup Plugin system lateStartup finished in 0:00:01.094
2015-12-22 11:28:29,586 WARN [localhost-startStop-1] [atlassian.confluence.plugin.PluginFrameworkContextListener] contextInitialized Not starting full plugin system due to error in main spring context
2015-12-22 11:28:30,002 INFO [localhost-startStop-1] [com.atlassian.confluence.lifecycle] init Confluence is ready to serve
{noformat}
The upgrade task is not triggered.

h3. Root cause: 
The cluster setting {{<property name="confluence.cluster">true</property>}} seems cause the Application initialisation failure. 

h3. Workaround solution: 
Edit the file confluence.cfg.xml to change the setting: 
# {{<setupStep>complete</setupStep>}}
# {{<property name="confluence.cluster">false</property>}} 
# {{<setupType>cluster</setupType>}}

Clear the plugin cache and remove the folder webresource-temp before restart. Once Confluence is started, you might need to go to the page "<Confluence base URL>/fixonly/fixlicense.action" and update the license to an evaluation license. Then restart to trigger the upgrade procedure again. Once the upgrade is done, we can perform the migration from standalone to Data Center.

fields.description:
h6. Summary
There is a typographical error in Confluence installation with MySQL Database. The error displayed in the warning message indicating that the user should add specific character encoding should they plan to use non-latin characters.

h6. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Confluence as per the instructions available in [this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/database-setup-for-mysql-128747.html].
# Noticed that the warning message with typographical error shown on _Configure Database_ page. 

h6. Expected Results
The warning message should be:

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40289].
  {panel}

h2. Summary

The WebDAV Launcher Office Connector is not signed correctly and so does not install or run in Firefox 43.0 or greater. This is [a recent change in Mozilla policy|https://wiki.mozilla.org/Addons/Extension_Signing] for extension signing.

h2. Environment
* Firefox 43.0 or higher
* WebDAV Launcher 1.0.8.1-signed
* Windows, Linux or Mac

h2. Steps to Reproduce
In Firefox
# Go to Help > About Firefox
# Make sure Firefox is version 43.0 or higher
# Uninstall the WebDav Launcher

In Confluence
# Go to a page with a Word document as an attachment
# Click on the Word document
# Click ... > Edit in Office
# Click Ok for the Download box
# Click Allow

See error

h2. Expected Results
The document should load in Word

h2. Actual Results
The Firefox add-on is not added. If it is already added, it will not work. The Add-on shows
{noformat}
The add-on downloaded from this site could not be installed because it appears to be corrupt.
{noformat}
The WebDAV launcher is disabled with the message
{noformat}
WebDAV Launcher could not be verified for use in Firefox and has been disabled.
{noformat}
 
h2. Notes
This is [a change in Firefox with Add-ons that are not signed correctly|https://wiki.mozilla.org/Addons/Extension_Signing].

h2.Workaround 1
# Download the plugin directly from mozilla (using Chrome so it doesn't auto install)  https://addons.mozilla.org/firefox/downloads/file/259818/webdav_launcher-1.0.8-fx.xpi
# Go to {{about:addons}}, then Cog Menu > Install Add-On from file and select the {{.xpi}} file
# Click Install on the pop-up box, then Restart

h2.Workaround 2
# Go the location bar and enter {{about:config}}
# Click _I'll be careful, I promise!_
# In the new Search field at the top enter {{xpinstall.signatures.required}}
# Double click the entry to make it *false*

You can also put this entry in {{user.js}} in the firefox profile directory
{code:title=user.js|language=javascript}
user_pref("xpinstall.signatures.required", false);
{code}

The plugin will now work.
fields.summary: WebDAV Launcher Office Connector is broken in Firefox 43.0

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40275].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
* This specific timezone has a different DST from other similar timezones. Users have to change it manually everytime it switches. It would help if the mentioned timezone could be found in the UI, as it is unique.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Log into Confluence, go to user *Profile* > *Settings* click on *edit* and select time zone.

h3. Expected results
* Paraguay/Asuncion Timezone in the UI.

h3. Actual results
* Paraguay/Asuncion Timezone missing from the UI.

h3. Workaround
* You can configure it by setting the timezone in the JAVA environment, your JVM for Confluence, see [Setting the timezone for the JAVA environment|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Setting+the+timezone+for+the+JAVA+environment], a list for the [Timezone|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones] then you can configure your [Confluence System Properties|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/configuring-system-properties-168002854.html] for your desired timezone, it will be set as *default* when Confluence starts up (users can still choose their own timezone through the UI).
fields.summary: Missing Paraguay/Asuncion Timezone from the UI

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40272].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Customizing the *Link* Color via the [Customising Colour Schemes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/customising-colour-schemes-135906.html] panel does not affect all links in the sidebar within Spaces.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* *Confluence Administration* > *General Configuration* > *Colour Scheme* > *Edit*
* Change *Links* to a custom color (#E90029)
* *Save*

h3. Expected Results
All links should be turned red on all pages-- Dashboard, Spaces, Pages

h3. Actual Results
Not all links' colors are changed. If you go to any Space, the *page tree* will not be affected
!Screen Shot 2015-12-17 at 12.03.03 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
* Tested, and does not affect versions 5.8.18, 5.8.16
* Version 6.0.0-OD-2016.02: Only affect unvisited links. Visited links worked fine.

h3. Workaround (For Server Version)
Adding the below CSS to fix the issue:
* *Confluence Administration* > *General Configuration* > *Style Sheet* > *Edit*
* {code}
.acs-side-bar a,
.acs-side-bar td a
{ color: #E90029; }
{code}
* *Save*

No workaround for Cloud version at the moment
fields.summary: Customizing Link Color via Customizing Color Schemes does not affect Sidebar links in Spaces

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-40249].
  {panel}

Retrieving inline comment replies (/rest/inlinecomments/1.0/comments/<comment_id>/replies) is an operation that requires two database connections.

If a page has a sizable number of resolved inline comments (20 in my test), that each have a number of comments (5 in my test), and the user opens up the "resolved comments" display for the page, the browser will launch off an individual request for every comment.  This flood of requests can cause DBCP exhaustion due to requiring 2 DB connections.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Create a new page
# Add 20 inline comments to it
# Add 5 replies to each inline comment
# Resolve all inline comments
# Refresh the page to ensure browser doesn't have anything stored locally
# Click the "Resolved comments" menu item from the "..."

*Expected behaviour*
- A single request is launched to retrieve the information
- The information is displayed

*Actual behaviour*
- Partial information is displayed (and may even look accurate, but it's incomplete)
- Confluence locks up until the DBCP requests time out
fields.summary: Listing resolved inline comments does not batch the request, leading to DBCP exhaustion
